repnme.cdata!: Togo - Power Rehabilitation and Extension Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the project is rated
            marginally satisfactory, for although most components were
            implemented, and the privatization of the Compagnie Energie
            Electrique du Togo (CEET) -not foreseen at appraisal -
            represents a major progress, the overall environment, have
            not been conducive to an improved performance, as expected
            at appraisal. While the Bank's performance is rated
            satisfactory, the performance of the borrower showed mixed
            results, for, contrary to its commitments, the borrower
            continued to interfere with the management of CEET. The
            lessons convey, first and foremost, that expected tools,
            namely the performance contract, envisaged during
            preparation to strengthen institutional performance, was not
            a sufficient tool, nor in reducing Government interference.
            However, the agreement reached later with the Government for
            CEET's privatization, which was not an option
            initially, turned the project into a successful operation,
            accepted and supported by the Government and staff at large.
            The economic and political environment, did affect
            CEET's performance, thus, it is suggested that projects
            should be undertaken under sound macroeconomic frameworks,
            to minimize political risks. Furthermore, a comprehensive
            Mid-term Review can help identify problems, and take
            corrective actions towards the achievement of project objectives.

repnme.cdata!: Togo - Power Rehabilitation and Extension Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project aims at correcting the
            critical deficiencies in the power sector by : a)
            streamlining the relationship between CEET (Compagnie
            Energie Electrique du Togo) and the Government (GOT); b)
            reinforcing CEET's organization and effecting
            improvements in all aspects of operations, including
            introduction of a performance contract with specific
            efficiency targets between CEET and GOT; and c) financing
            part of the investment program of the power sector for the
            period 1990-1994 including the rehabilitation, reinforcement
            and extension of the distribution grid, as well as the
            economically justified connection of new loads.  The project
            comprises the following components : 1) the rehabilitation
            and extension of the Lome distribution system, together with
            related engineering and other services; 2) technical
            assistance; and 3) training.

repnme.cdata!: Togo - Power Rehabilitation and Extension Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Power Rehabilitation and Extension
            Project for Togo aims at correcting the critical
            deficiencies in the power sector by: a) streamlining the
            relationship between CEET (Compagnie Energie Electrique du
            Togo) and the Government (GOT); b) reinforcing CEET's
            organization and effecting improvements in all aspects of
            operations, including introduction of a performance contract
            with specific efficiency targets between CEET and GOT; and
            c) financing part of the investment program of the power
            sector for the period 1990-1994 including the
            rehabilitation, reinforcement and extension of the
            distribution grid, as well as the economically justified
            connection of new loads. The project comprises the following
            components: 1) the rehabilitation and extension of the Lome
            distribution system, together with related engineering and
            other services; 2) technical assistance; and 3) training.
